channel.title: Archive on CAMGDP: Central Asia and Mongolia Gender Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in Archive on CAMGDP: Central Asia and Mongolia Gender Data Portal

item.title: Family and Women's Committee of Uzbekistan
item.description: Founded in 2022, Family and Women’s Committee of Uzbekistan is a state institution aimed at protecting women’s civil, labor, and human rights. It publishes reports and shares other updates on issues of women and family in the country.

item.title: Institute of Oriental Studies of the Academy of Sciences
item.description: Founded in 1943, the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Academy of Sciences is a Tashkent-based research institution that specializes on collection of manuscripts. At the present time, its manuscript collection contains about 26,000 volumes and includes works written in Uzbek, Arabic, Persian, Tajik, Urdu, Azeri, Ottoman Turkish, Tatar, Turkmen, Uighur and other languages.

item.title: National Archive of the Republic of Kazakhstan
item.description: Opened in 2006, the National Archive of the Republic of Kazakhstan is a central repository for historical documents in Kazakhstan. It is located in Astana.

item.title: Kazakh Research Institute of Culture
item.description: First founded in 1934, Kazakh Research Institute of Culture is a research center for art, culture, history, and archaeology. Its mission is to “conduct an in-depth systemic analysis in the sphere of culture in accordance with the Conception of cultural policy of the Republic of Kazakhstan, integration into world cultural space and effective international cooperation.” The institute is located in Almaty.

item.title: National Library of Uzbekistan named after Alisher Navoi
item.description: Originally founded in 1870, the National Library of Uzbekistan received its current name in 2002. It is the main state book depository for national and foreign press, information and research institution, and a methodological center for all libraries of the country. The National Library is located in Tashkent.

item.title: Kok.team
item.description: Founded in 2017 and dissolved in 2022, Kok.team was a grassroots LGBT organization dedicated to providing information on the LGBT issues in Kazakh. Digital archive contains articles, podcasts and videos of Kazakhstani LGBT  community. Available in Kazakh and Russian with occasional translation to English.

item.title: Adilet.Zan
item.description: Founded in 2012, Adilet.Zan is a legal information system of Regulatory Legal Acts under the Ministry of Justice Institute of Legislation and Legal Information. The database contains more than 330 thousand legal documents, including Kazakhstan’s Concept of Family and Gender Policies.

item.title: Ak Orda
item.description: Ak Orda is the official website of the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Contains official documents, such as the constitution, state strategies and programs, and constitutional laws, as well as an archive of the documents. The website is not search friendly.

item.title: TengriNews
item.description: Founded in 2016, TengriNews offers news coverage of current events in Kazakhstan and the world and a database of legislative documents.

item.title: Units to Guard Women against Violence
item.description: Founded in 1998, the Republic of Kazakhstan Administrations of Internal Affairs’ Units to Guard Women against Violence is a domestic body on the basis of police work force designed to protect constitutional rights of women, coordinate detention and prosecution processes in the case of the detention of women, and organize work to prevent domestic violence against women. The official text of the establishment of the units could be found here. In 2021, Kaz Fem feminist organization criticized the compensation policy of the Units’ workers stating that on average its female workers earn less than workers of other internal affairs’ units.
